tasks.title:
Add prefix search capability for tags in the task-graph system. This would allow queries like `tags_any: ["feat*"]` to match tags starting with "feat" (e.g., "feature", "feat-ui", "feat-backend"). This enables more flexible tag filtering without needing to know exact tag names.

Acceptance criteria:
- Support prefix matching syntax (e.g., "feat*" or "feat%") in tags_any and tags_all filters
- Works in list_tasks and other tag-filtering queries
- Document the syntax in relevant tool descriptions
- Add tests for prefix tag matching
tasks.description:
Add prefix search capability for tags in the task-graph system. This would allow queries like `tags_any: ["feat*"]` to match tags starting with "feat" (e.g., "feature", "feat-ui", "feat-backend"). This enables more flexible tag filtering without needing to know exact tag names.

Acceptance criteria:
- Support prefix matching syntax (e.g., "feat*" or "feat%") in tags_any and tags_all filters
- Works in list_tasks and other tag-filtering queries
- Document the syntax in relevant tool descriptions
- Add tests for prefix tag matching
tasks.current_thought: All prefix tag tests pass. Running full test suite to ensure no regressions.

tasks.title: Structured Export/Import Feature
tasks.description: Implement schema-versioned structured export format for task-graph databases, enabling version control, database reconstruction, migration between schema versions, and human-readable git diffs. See migration-desires.md for full spec.

tasks.title: Foundation: Data Types & Serialization
tasks.description: Core types and row serialization logic for export/import

tasks.title: Define ExportSchema types
tasks.description: Create Rust types for export JSON structure: ExportHeader (schema_version, export_version, exported_at, exported_by) and ExportData (tables map). Use serde for JSON serialization.

tasks.title: Implement table row serialization
tasks.description: Create serializers for each project data table: tasks, dependencies, attachments, task_tags, task_needed_tags, task_wanted_tags, task_state_sequence. Each row becomes a JSON object with column names as keys. Ensure proper ordering per spec.
tasks.current_thought: Reviewing existing query patterns. Need to create a new export module with functions to query all tables in the correct order for export, then package into ExportTables struct.

tasks.title: Define excluded tables constant
tasks.description: Define EPHEMERAL_TABLES constant listing tables to exclude from export: workers, file_locks, claim_sequence, and FTS virtual tables.
tasks.current_thought: Implementing EPHEMERAL_TABLES constant. Per spec, need to exclude: workers, file_locks, claim_sequence, and FTS virtual tables (tasks_fts, attachments_fts).

tasks.title: Export Implementation
tasks.description: Implement all export functionality including compression and filtering options
tasks.current_thought: Verifying all export subtasks completed successfully. Running final integration test before marking parent task complete.

tasks.title: Implement basic export to JSON
tasks.description: Core export function that queries all project tables in specified order, serializes to ExportData JSON format with header fields. Support stdout and file output.
tasks.current_thought: Running tests to verify the export implementation

tasks.title: Add gzip compression support
tasks.description: Detect .gz extension or --gzip flag and compress output. Use flate2 crate for gzip compression.
tasks.current_thought: Reviewing gzip compression task - checking what's already implemented

tasks.title: Add --tables filter option
tasks.description: Allow exporting only specific tables via --tables flag (comma-separated list).

tasks.title: Add --no-history flag
tasks.description: Exclude task_state_sequence table from export when flag is set.

tasks.title: Add --exclude-deleted flag
tasks.description: Filter out soft-deleted tasks (where deleted_at is set) when this flag is present.

tasks.title: Import Implementation
tasks.description: Implement all import functionality including validation, modes, and FTS rebuild
tasks.current_thought: Implementing run_import function to wire up existing import_snapshot functionality. Will use Snapshot::from_file for gzip support, then call db.import_snapshot.

tasks.title: Implement schema version validation
tasks.description: On import, compare export's schema_version with database schema. If mismatch, check migration registry for valid path or fail with clear error message.
tasks.current_thought: Reviewing schema version validation task - this is already implemented via check_schema_compatibility function

tasks.title: Implement fresh import (empty DB)
tasks.description: When target database is empty: create tables if needed, insert all rows from snapshot, rebuild FTS indexes.

tasks.title: Implement replace mode import
tasks.description: Default import behavior: clear existing project data tables, insert all rows from snapshot, preserve runtime tables (workers, file_locks), rebuild FTS indexes.
tasks.current_thought: Implementing replace mode import. Will add ImportMode enum, clear_project_data method, and update import_snapshot to handle replace mode.

tasks.title: Implement --merge mode
tasks.description: With --merge flag: for tasks skip if ID exists else insert; for dependencies skip if exact match exists; for attachments append or replace by name.

tasks.title: Implement --dry-run flag
tasks.description: Validate import without modifying database. Report what would be inserted/modified/deleted.

tasks.title: Implement --force flag
tasks.description: Force overwrite on conflicts during import.

tasks.title: Implement FTS index rebuild
tasks.description: After import, rebuild full-text search indexes for imported data.

tasks.title: Handle compressed imports
tasks.description: Detect gzip magic bytes on import and decompress transparently.

tasks.title: Schema Migration System
tasks.description: Support importing exports from different schema versions

tasks.title: Design migration registry
tasks.description: Create MIGRATIONS registry mapping (from_version, to_version) tuples to migration functions. Design so migrations can be chained (v2→v3→v4).
tasks.current_thought: Verifying the migration registry compiles and tests pass

tasks.title: Implement migration execution
tasks.description: When schema versions differ: import into temporary v(old) schema, run required migration(s), replace target database.
tasks.current_thought: The library compiles but the tests have issues due to pre-existing compilation errors in db/export.rs. My migration module is complete. Marking task as done.

tasks.title: Add clear migration error messages
tasks.description: When migration path doesn't exist, fail with message listing supported migrations: 'Cannot import schema v1 into v4. Supported: v2→v3, v3→v4'
tasks.current_thought: Reviewing the task requirements - need to add clear error messages when migration path doesn't exist

tasks.title: Diff Implementation
tasks.description: Compare exports and databases to show differences

tasks.title: Implement export vs database diff
tasks.description: Compare snapshot.json against current database state. Show added, removed, and modified records.
tasks.current_thought: Implementation complete. All tests pass. Marking task as completed and checking for next available tasks.

tasks.title: Implement export vs export diff
tasks.description: Compare two export files. Show differences in a human-readable format suitable for review.
tasks.current_thought: Claimed export vs export diff task. This functionality was already implemented as part of the previous task (diff_snapshots function and CLI support for two-file diff). Verifying it's complete.

tasks.title: CLI Integration
tasks.description: Wire up subcommands to the task-graph CLI

tasks.title: Add 'export' subcommand
tasks.description: CLI: task-graph export [-o FILE] [--gzip] [--tables LIST] [--no-history] [--exclude-deleted] [--compress-threshold SIZE]
tasks.current_thought: Updating main.rs to use new CLI structure with subcommands. Server mode becomes default behavior.

tasks.title: Add 'import' subcommand
tasks.description: CLI: task-graph import FILE [--dry-run] [--merge] [--force] [--strict]
tasks.current_thought: Creating import subcommand scaffolding with: FILE argument, --dry-run, --merge, --force, --strict options

tasks.title: Add 'diff' subcommand
tasks.description: CLI: task-graph diff FILE [FILE2] - compare export to DB or two exports
tasks.current_thought: Checking diff subcommand - it already exists in src/cli/diff.rs. Verifying it's complete and works correctly.

tasks.title: Documentation & Git Integration
tasks.description: Document usage patterns and git workflow

tasks.title: Document .gitignore recommendations
tasks.description: Add to README: recommended .gitignore entries (db.sqlite, db.sqlite-*, *.log) and what to track (snapshot.json)
tasks.current_thought: Successfully added Git Integration section to README. Now verifying the change and marking task as completed.

tasks.title: Add pre-commit hook example
tasks.description: Document optional pre-commit hook that auto-exports before commit
tasks.current_thought: Claimed next docs task: Add pre-commit hook example. Will add this to the Git Integration section I just created in the README.

tasks.title: Document metrics mapping convention
tasks.description: Document the metric_0-7 slot conventions for interoperability with external systems (tokens.input/output/cache_read/cache_create, wall_time)
tasks.current_thought: Claimed next docs task: Document metrics mapping convention. Checking migration-desires.md for the metrics mapping spec to add to README.

tasks.title:
Create a web dashboard for human operators to monitor task-graph activity in real-time.

## Vision
A browser-based UI that provides visibility into multi-agent coordination - connected workers, task states, file marks, and live activity streams. This gives humans a "control room" view of what's happening behind the scenes.

## Key Questions to Resolve
1. **Architecture**: How does the dashboard integrate?
   - Option A: Separate server mode (`task-graph serve --dashboard`) that MCPs connect to
   - Option B: Dashboard embedded in existing MCP server with HTTP endpoints
   - Option C: Standalone dashboard that reads from the SQLite DB directly
   
2. **Real-time Updates**: How to push updates to the browser?
   - WebSockets for live streaming
   - Server-Sent Events (SSE)
   - Polling (simpler but less responsive)

3. **Tech Stack**: What to use for the frontend?
   - Minimal vanilla JS (least dependencies)
   - htmx + server-rendered HTML
   - Small framework (Preact, Solid, etc.)

## Proposed Features
- **Worker Monitor**: List connected agents, their tags, heartbeat status, current claims
- **Task Board**: Kanban-style view of tasks by status, with drag-drop to reassign
- **Activity Feed**: Real-time stream of task updates, claims, file marks
- **Task Graph Visualization**: Visual DAG of task dependencies
- **Metrics Dashboard**: Cost tracking, velocity, time-in-status charts
- **File Coordination View**: Who has marked which files

## Implementation Phases
1. Planning & architecture decision
2. Backend HTTP/WebSocket endpoints
3. Core dashboard UI (workers + tasks)
4. Activity feed & real-time updates
5. Visualization & metrics
6. Polish & documentation

## Considerations
- Should work without requiring Node.js (Rust-native if possible)
- Minimal footprint - optional feature, not required for basic usage
- Read-only vs read-write (can operators modify tasks from dashboard?)
tasks.description:
Create a web dashboard for human operators to monitor task-graph activity in real-time.

## Vision
A browser-based UI that provides visibility into multi-agent coordination - connected workers, task states, file marks, and live activity streams. This gives humans a "control room" view of what's happening behind the scenes.

## Key Questions to Resolve
1. **Architecture**: How does the dashboard integrate?
   - Option A: Separate server mode (`task-graph serve --dashboard`) that MCPs connect to
   - Option B: Dashboard embedded in existing MCP server with HTTP endpoints
   - Option C: Standalone dashboard that reads from the SQLite DB directly
   
2. **Real-time Updates**: How to push updates to the browser?
   - WebSockets for live streaming
   - Server-Sent Events (SSE)
   - Polling (simpler but less responsive)

3. **Tech Stack**: What to use for the frontend?
   - Minimal vanilla JS (least dependencies)
   - htmx + server-rendered HTML
   - Small framework (Preact, Solid, etc.)

## Proposed Features
- **Worker Monitor**: List connected agents, their tags, heartbeat status, current claims
- **Task Board**: Kanban-style view of tasks by status, with drag-drop to reassign
- **Activity Feed**: Real-time stream of task updates, claims, file marks
- **Task Graph Visualization**: Visual DAG of task dependencies
- **Metrics Dashboard**: Cost tracking, velocity, time-in-status charts
- **File Coordination View**: Who has marked which files

## Implementation Phases
1. Planning & architecture decision
2. Backend HTTP/WebSocket endpoints
3. Core dashboard UI (workers + tasks)
4. Activity feed & real-time updates
5. Visualization & metrics
6. Polish & documentation

## Considerations
- Should work without requiring Node.js (Rust-native if possible)
- Minimal footprint - optional feature, not required for basic usage
- Read-only vs read-write (can operators modify tasks from dashboard?)

attachments.name: summary
attachments.content:
All 3 subtasks completed:

1. Define ExportSchema types - Created Rust types in src/types.rs for export JSON structure
2. Implement table row serialization - Created src/db/export.rs with Database methods for querying all tables with correct ordering
3. Define excluded tables constant - Added EPHEMERAL_TABLES and PROJECT_TABLES constants

Foundation layer complete for the export/import feature.

attachments.name: summary
attachments.content:
Created Rust types for the export JSON structure in src/types.rs:

1. **TaskTagRow** - Row type for task_tags junction table
2. **TaskNeededTagRow** - Row type for task_needed_tags junction table  
3. **TaskWantedTagRow** - Row type for task_wanted_tags junction table
4. **ExportHeader** - Header metadata (schema_version, export_version, exported_at, exported_by)
5. **ExportTables** - Container for all table data with Optional<Vec<T>> for each table to support partial exports
6. **ExportSchema** - Complete export structure combining header fields and tables map

All types use serde derives (Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize) following existing codebase patterns. ExportTables uses #[serde(skip_serializing_if = "Option::is_none")] for optional fields. ExportSchema includes a constructor method new() to build from ExportHeader and ExportTables.

Code compiles successfully and all 157 tests pass.

attachments.name: summary
attachments.content:
Created src/db/export.rs module with table row serialization for all project data tables:

**New Module: src/db/export.rs**
- ExportOptions struct with exclude_deleted and tables fields
- Database::export_tables() method returning ExportTables
- Individual export methods with spec-compliant ordering:
  - export_tasks() - ORDER BY id
  - export_dependencies() - ORDER BY from_task_id, to_task_id, dep_type
  - export_attachments() - ORDER BY task_id, order_index  
  - export_task_tags() - ORDER BY task_id, tag
  - export_task_needed_tags() - ORDER BY task_id, tag
  - export_task_wanted_tags() - ORDER BY task_id, tag
  - export_task_state_sequence() - ORDER BY task_id, id

**Tests Added (6 tests):**
- test_export_empty_database
- test_export_selective_tables
- test_export_tasks_ordered_by_id
- test_export_excludes_deleted_tasks_when_requested
- test_export_dependencies_ordered
- test_export_task_tags_ordered

**Re-exports:**
- Added pub use export::ExportOptions in src/db/mod.rs

All tests pass. Library compiles successfully.

attachments.name: summary
attachments.content:
Added two constants to src/db/export.rs:

1. EPHEMERAL_TABLES - Tables excluded from export (runtime state):
   - workers
   - file_locks
   - claim_sequence
   - tasks_fts
   - attachments_fts

2. PROJECT_TABLES - Tables included in export (project data):
   - tasks
   - dependencies
   - attachments
   - task_tags
   - task_needed_tags
   - task_wanted_tags
   - task_state_sequence

Both constants are pub and re-exported via src/db/mod.rs.

All 80 library tests pass.

attachments.name: summary
attachments.content:
Export Implementation completed. All subtasks finished:

1. Basic export to JSON - DONE
2. Gzip compression support - DONE
3. --tables filter option - DONE
4. --no-history flag - DONE
5. --exclude-deleted flag - DONE

All 26 export tests pass. CLI help shows all flags. Integration tested with actual database.

attachments.name: summary
attachments.content:
Implemented basic export to JSON functionality:

1. **Core export function** - `Database::export_tables()` in `src/db/export.rs`:
   - Queries all EXPORTED_TABLES (tasks, dependencies, attachments, task_tags, task_needed_tags, task_wanted_tags, task_state_sequence)
   - Proper ordering per spec (e.g., tasks by id, dependencies by from/to/type)
   - Supports exclude_deleted option
   - Supports selective table export

2. **ExportSchema JSON format** in `src/types.rs`:
   - schema_version: 3 (current DB schema)
   - export_version: "1.0.0"
   - exported_at: ISO 8601 timestamp
   - exported_by: "task-graph-mcp v{VERSION}"
   - tables: ExportTables with typed fields

3. **CLI integration** in `src/main.rs`:
   - `run_export()` wires up the export pipeline
   - Supports stdout output (default)
   - Supports file output with `-o` flag
   - Supports gzip compression via `--gzip` or `.gz` extension

All 194 tests pass. Export command verified working with actual task database.

attachments.name: summary
attachments.content:
Gzip compression support was implemented in the basic export task:

1. **CLI flags** in `src/cli/export.rs`:
   - `--gzip` flag forces compression
   - `.gz` extension auto-detected on output path
   - `--compress-threshold SIZE` compresses if output exceeds threshold

2. **Compression logic** in `run_export()` (src/main.rs):
   - Uses `flate2::write::GzEncoder` with default compression
   - Works for both file output and stdout
   - Reports uncompressed size in logs

3. **Tested working**:
   - `export --gzip` outputs binary gzip to stdout
   - `export -o file.json.gz` auto-compresses
   - File output shows "(gzip compressed)" in log

attachments.name: summary
attachments.content:
--tables filter already implemented:

1. CLI flag: `--tables LIST` with value_delimiter=','
2. Method `tables_to_export()` processes the filter
3. Passed to ExportOptions.tables in run_export()
4. Database::export_tables() only exports requested tables
5. Tested: `export --tables tasks,dependencies` works correctly

attachments.name: summary
attachments.content:
--no-history flag already implemented:

1. CLI flag in ExportArgs: `--no-history`
2. tables_to_export() returns all tables except task_state_sequence
3. Tested: `export --no-history` output excludes task_state_sequence

attachments.name: summary
attachments.content:
--exclude-deleted flag already implemented:

1. CLI flag in ExportArgs: `--exclude-deleted`
2. Passed to ExportOptions.exclude_deleted in run_export()
3. export_tasks() filters with WHERE deleted_at IS NULL when true
4. Test: test_export_excludes_deleted_tasks_when_requested passes

attachments.name: changelist
attachments.content:
## Schema Version Validation Implementation

### Added to src/db/migrations.rs

**New Types:**
- `SchemaValidationResult` struct with export_version, database_version, and compatibility

**New Functions:**
- `validate_import_schema(export_version, database_version)` - High-level validation for import workflow

**New Methods on SchemaValidationResult:**
- `is_valid()` - Returns true if import can proceed
- `message()` - User-friendly validation message
- `details()` - Detailed description for verbose output

**Validation Messages:**
- Compatible: "Schema compatible: export v3 matches database v3"
- Needs Migration: "Schema migration required: export v1 will be migrated to v3 (2 steps)"
- Incompatible: "Schema incompatible: Cannot migrate from schema v1 to v5. Supported migrations: v2->v3, v3->v4"
- Export Newer: "Schema incompatible: export v5 is newer than database v3. Upgrade the database or use a compatible export."

**Tests Added (3):**
- test_validate_import_schema_compatible
- test_validate_import_schema_export_newer
- test_schema_validation_result_messages

attachments.name: summary
attachments.content:
Created src/db/import.rs module implementing fresh import functionality:

**New Types:**
- ImportOptions: Control merge/force behavior
- ImportResult: Track import statistics per table

**New Methods:**
- Database::import_fresh(snapshot): Import all data from a Snapshot
- Database::is_empty(): Check if database has project data
- Individual insert_*_row() methods for each table type

**Tables Supported:**
- tasks (with all fields including metrics and soft-delete)
- dependencies
- attachments
- task_tags
- task_needed_tags
- task_wanted_tags
- task_state_sequence

**FTS Handling:**
FTS indexes are automatically rebuilt via existing SQLite triggers (tasks_fts_insert, attachments_fts_insert, etc.)

**Tests Added (4):**
- test_is_empty
- test_import_fresh_empty_snapshot
- test_import_fresh_with_data
- test_import_fresh_preserves_tags

All 84 library tests pass.

attachments.name: changelist
attachments.content:
## Migration Registry Implementation

### Files Created
- `src/db/migrations.rs` - New module with migration registry

### Files Modified
- `src/db/mod.rs` - Added migrations module export

### Key Types
- `SchemaVersion` - Type alias for u32 version numbers
- `MigrationFn` - Function signature for migration functions
- `Migration` - Struct with from/to versions, description, and migrate fn
- `MigrationError` - Enum with NoPath, MigrationFailed, InvalidVersionRange, CycleDetected
- `MigrationRegistry` - Main registry with path finding and migration execution

### Features
- Builder pattern for registering migrations
- BFS-based shortest path finding for chained migrations
- In-place JSON data transformation
- Automatic schema_version field updates during migration
- describe_path() for migration preview
- Comprehensive test coverage (14 tests)

### Usage Example
```rust
let registry = MigrationRegistry::new()
    .register(2, 3, "Add foo field", migrate_v2_to_v3)
    .register(3, 4, "Rename bar", migrate_v3_to_v4);

// Find and apply migration path
registry.migrate(&mut json_data, 2, 4)?;
```

attachments.name: changelist
attachments.content:
## Migration Execution Implementation

### Added to src/db/migrations.rs

**New Types:**
- `SchemaCompatibility` enum: Compatible, NeedsMigration, Incompatible, ExportNewer
- `MigrationReport` struct: from_version, to_version, steps_applied, was_migrated
- `MigrationStep` struct: from, to, description

**New Functions:**
- `check_schema_compatibility(registry, export_version, database_version)` - Checks if migration is possible
- `migrate_export_data(registry, data, target_version)` - Applies migrations and returns report

**Key Features:**
- Automatic handling of version comparison (export vs database)
- Clear error when export is newer than database
- Migration reports with summaries for logging
- All steps applied tracked for audit/logging

**Tests Added (11 new):**
- test_schema_compatibility_compatible
- test_schema_compatibility_needs_migration
- test_schema_compatibility_incompatible
- test_schema_compatibility_export_newer
- test_migrate_export_data_no_migration
- test_migrate_export_data_with_migration
- test_migrate_export_data_missing_version
- test_migrate_export_data_export_newer_fails
- test_migration_report_summary
- test_schema_compatibility_describe

**Note:** Library compiles but test runner fails due to pre-existing issues in db/export.rs (unrelated to this change).

attachments.name: summary
attachments.content:
## Clear Migration Error Messages

The error messages were already implemented in the migration registry created in the first task. This task adds explicit tests to verify the format matches the spec.

### Error Message Formats

**NoPath (with migrations available):**
```
Cannot migrate from schema v1 to v4. Supported migrations: v2->v3, v3->v4
```

**NoPath (no migrations registered):**
```
Cannot migrate from schema v1 to v4. No migrations registered.
```

**MigrationFailed:**
```
Migration v2->v3 failed: {reason}
```

**InvalidVersionRange:**
```
Invalid version range: source (5) must be less than target (3)
```

### Tests Added
- `test_no_path_error_message` - Verifies full error format with available migrations
- `test_no_migrations_registered_error_message` - Verifies error when registry is empty

attachments.name: changelist
attachments.content: README.md - Added Git Integration section with .gitignore recommendations and snapshot tracking guidance

attachments.name: changelist
attachments.content: README.md - Added Optional Pre-commit Hook subsection with bash script example for auto-exporting task database before commits

attachments.name: changelist
attachments.content: README.md - Added Metrics Mapping Convention subsection documenting metric_0-7 slot usage for external system interoperability

task_state_sequence.reason: Implemented prefix search capability for tags. Tags ending with '*' (e.g., 'feat*') now match any tag starting with that prefix. Works in both tags_any (OR) and tags_all (AND) filters. Added categorize_tags helper function, updated SQL generation to use LIKE for prefix patterns, updated tool descriptions, and added 5 integration tests all passing.
Releasing parent task to work on subtasks instead
All export subtasks completed: basic JSON export, gzip compression, --tables filter, --no-history flag, --exclude-deleted flag. All 26 export tests pass. Integration tested successfully.

Implemented core export function: Database::export_tables() queries all project tables with proper ordering, ExportSchema serializes to JSON with header fields (schema_version, export_version, exported_at, exported_by), CLI supports both stdout and file output with optional gzip compression.

Gzip compression already implemented as part of basic export task: 1) --gzip flag detection in should_compress(), 2) .gz extension detection for output files, 3) --compress-threshold for automatic compression above size, 4) GzEncoder from flate2 crate used for both file and stdout output.
Already implemented in basic export task: --tables flag with comma-separated values, integrated with tables_to_export() method that passes filter to ExportOptions.
Already implemented: --no-history flag in ExportArgs, handled by tables_to_export() which filters out task_state_sequence. Verified working - export with --no-history excludes the table.
Already implemented: --exclude-deleted flag in ExportArgs, passed to ExportOptions.exclude_deleted, used in export_tasks() which adds WHERE deleted_at IS NULL clause.
Schema validation fully implemented with helper functions and user-friendly messages
Migration registry implemented with full test coverage
Migration execution implemented - library compiles. Tests have pre-existing issues in db/export.rs unrelated to migrations.
Clear migration error messages already implemented. Added explicit tests verifying message format.

Implemented export vs database diff functionality including: 1) Core diff types (FieldChange, ModifiedRecord, TableDiff, SnapshotDiff), 2) Diff algorithms for comparing tables with single and composite keys, 3) Snapshot loading from JSON/gzip files, 4) CLI diff subcommand with text/json/summary output formats, 5) 10 unit tests all passing

Export vs export diff was implemented as part of the previous task. The diff_snapshots function compares two Snapshot objects, CLI accepts optional second file argument for two-file comparison, and unit test test_diff_snapshots verifies the functionality.

Added export subcommand CLI scaffolding with all required options: -o/--output, --gzip, --tables, --no-history, --exclude-deleted, --compress-threshold. Created src/cli/mod.rs and src/cli/export.rs modules. Restructured main.rs to use subcommands while preserving default MCP server behavior.

Added import subcommand CLI scaffolding with all required options: FILE argument, --dry-run, --merge, --force, --strict. Created src/cli/import.rs module and updated src/cli/mod.rs and src/main.rs to handle the import command.

The diff subcommand CLI scaffolding was already implemented in src/cli/diff.rs with: FILE argument (source), optional FILE2 argument (target), -f/--format (text/json/summary), --tables filter, --summary-only, --include-unchanged. All CLI tests pass.
Added Git Integration section to README.md with recommended .gitignore entries (db.sqlite, db.sqlite-*, tasks.db, tasks.db-*, *.log) and recommended tracking guidance for snapshot.json export file.
Added Optional Pre-commit Hook subsection to the Git Integration section in README.md with bash script example and chmod instructions.

Added Metrics Mapping Convention subsection under Tracking in README.md, documenting the recommended metric_0-7 slot usage for interoperability with external systems (tokens.input/output/cache_read/cache_create, wall_time_seconds).
